headline: Nigeria loses 112 people to Lassa fever in 3 months — NCDC
summarized_story:

According to medical experts, Lassa fever is transmitted when the saliva, urine, and excreta of multi-mammalian rats come into contact with humans.
In some cases, Lassa fever has similar symptoms to malaria, appearing between one and three weeks after exposure to the virus.
The Agency explained that the animal vector for the Lassa virus, the multimammate rat, is found throughout the west African region, thereby calling on neighboring countries to stay alert on the spread of the Lassa fever.

headline: Investors rage as Chinmark Group CEO fails to repay funds
summarized_story:

headline: Boeing 737 plane with 133 passengers crashes in China
summarized_story:
A Boeing 737 passenger plane carrying 133 passengers has crashed in China, local media reported on Monday.
